description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73.a) to vary condition 2 (Approved Drawings) of planning permission: 177293FUL dated 16/04/2018 for: Construction of a two storey terrace of three houses with roofspace accomodation; and associated vehicle and cycle parking, amenity space and refuse storage (following demolition of two storey detached house). Variation seeks an amendment of the roof design from hip to gable and additional roof extensions and associated internal alterations to second floor and roof
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from 16 April 2018.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers:
1644 P101 (Location Plan),
1644 P201 (Existing Floor Plans)
1644 P202 (Existing Elevations)
1644 301 (Proposed Ground Floor & First Floor)
1644 P401 Rev A (Proposed Elevations and Section AA)
1644 P302 Rev A (Proposed Second Floor and Roof Plan)
1644 P403 Rev A (Proposed Side Elevations)

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, a schedule of details for the materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.  The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Samples of materials to be submitted to the council for approval in writing shall include:
(i)	bricks

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surroundings, in accordance with policies 7B and 7.4 of the Development Management DPD (2013); and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).
| A minimum of six cycle parking spaces shall be provided and located in a secure undercover lockable compound, prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 1.1 f of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the approved plans, further details of the forecourt layout shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development.  All detailed works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of the premises. Such details shall include:
(i) planting of the forecourt area with shrubs and/or small trees;
(ii) provision of planting along the front and side boundaries. Planting shall be visible from the street front to improve the visual amenity of the proposal
(iii) provision of x2 off-street parking spaces, the defined points of access and the surfacing materials to be used.
(iv) location and screened storage facilities for a minimum of six bins for waste and recycling

Any planting that is part of the approved scheme that within a period of five years after planting is removed, dies or becomes seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season and all planting shall be replaced with others of a similar size and species and in the same position, unless the Local Planning Authority first gives written consent to any variation.

The vehicle parking arrangements of the approved scheme shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose. No additional car parking shall be formed or made available except with the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision, highway and pedestrian safety; to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development; and to ensure the development is landscaped in the visual and ecological interests of the area within the site, in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 6.3, , 6.9, 6.11, 6.13, 7.4, 7.5 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016); The London Environment Strategy (2018); and policies 3.5, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018).

| Details of a demolition and site construction method statement and management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development.  The method statement/management plan shall include but not limited to the following;
i.	Construction worker parking;
ii.	Anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles;
iii.	Delivery times;
iv.	Dust suppression measures;
v.	Site security;
vi.	Vehicle manoeuvring and turning;
vii.	Location for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors office;
viii.	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents;
ix.	Measures to ensure the construction process does not effect of neighbouring highways;
x.	Details of wheel water spraying facilities;
xi.	Dust and noise/vibration mitigation measures.

Prior to the commencement of any construction work, all sensitive properties surrounding the site shall be notified in writing of the nature and duration of the works to be undertaken, and the name and address of a responsible person to whom enquiries / complaints should be directed. These details shall also be displayed at regular intervals around the site construction compound.

The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved. Any areas to be used for the storage of building materials or other site activities outside of the relevant phase of the development shall be returned to the original condition immediately following the practical completion of the development.
Such details shall be implemented or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.

Reason: To protect the amenity of local residents, to ensure adequate highway and safety in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 and 3.1 of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012), the National Planning Policy Framework (2018), and policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A - F of Part 1 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2014 (or any subsequent amendment to that order) no extensions or alterations, porches, or outbuildings shall be carried out at the dwellinghouse hereby approved without the prior permission of the local planning authority.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site, to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the area, and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012), policies 3.5, 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 3.5, 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018). | No part of the roof of the ground floor shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018). | The first floor side elevation windows of the development shall be fully obscure-glazed, and non-opening unless the parts of the window that can be opened are more than 1.7m above the finished floor level of the room in which the window is installed.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2018).
